chapter.title: Logging In to Knowledge
chapter.para: When the administrator creates an account for you, you will receive an email, which will contain login information (be sure to check your spam folder). This will enable you to access Knowledge. After your first login your password should be changed. If you do not receive an email with your account and login information, contact the Knowledge administrator.

section.title: User Roles
section.para:
Knowledge has six roles. Each of these roles have different permissions:
Read role: Users with Read role can view content
Editor role: Editors modify content, create new content, search, classify, and export content
Content Manager: The Content Manager has all the capabilities of the Editor role, export content, and can create a version of the content
System Manager: The System Manager has administrative priveleges of the whole environment
Administrator role: Administrators can create user accounts, modify user accounts, and have all the editing functionality as the Author role with the additional ability to release content
Automated: This is a role used for system to system communicaiton

section.title: Login
section.para:
To Login you will enter your username and password. If you forget either your user name or password, select the appropriate link in the Knowledge Login screen. Login
